intro: Schnella angulosa, commonly known as the angular schnella, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, angular stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a mild, spicy scent. Schnella angulosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
